Is it even possible to create a delightful experience in B2B/SaaS?

5 tactics used by successful products to turn reluctant users into loyal fans.

Many business software users don’t exactly choose to spend their day in a CRM or project management app. It’s part of the job. Unlike a social app or game that people use for fun, a B2B SaaS product is often a required tool.

You have to use it, so why bother with whimsy?

But as Slack’s design team points out:

“As a designer, your goal is to design a product that is both useful and valuable to the person using it, so they, in turn, end up utilising the product and (hopefully) paying for the services. A truly well-designed product is a win-win situation for both the customer and your business.”

Bringing delight into work tools can transform a required chore into something users actually want to use. And often, that makes the experience more productive.

Here are 5 ways B2B products can add delight to SaaS experiences, with real product examples and expert insights.

1. Speed up workflows with automation and AI

Delight comes from doing less, better
